alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:06PM EDT until July 09 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL ORANGE COUNTY... At 206 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Middletown, Port Jervis, Walden, Goshen, Howells, Montgomery, Florida, Otisville, Huguenot, Unionville, Scotchtown, Mechanicstown, Westtown, Maybrook, Slate Hill, Pine Bush, Pine Island, Circleville, Bullville and New Hampton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
